rules: Rule1: Provided that the researcher mastered statistics skill, the researcher uses the open science platform.
Rule2: Whenever the paper is submitted to a high impact journal, if it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher collaborated with a statistician.
Rule3: Under the condition that the preprint of the paper is published, the paper is not plagiarized.
Rule4: If the professor is tenured, then given that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.
Rule5: Should the researcher be promoted, then provided that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.
Rule6: In the event that the professor is grant funded, the professor is tenured.
Rule7: If the researcher is research recognized, then the researcher is promoted.
Rule8: Whenever the researcher received an award, the professor is grant funded.
Rule9: Either the researcher received an award or the paper achieved citation.
Rule10: Given that the researcher meets the tenure track condition, then either the researcher has programming skill or the project is research successful.
Rule11: If the paper achieved citation, then the paper has an influential finding.
Rule12: Whenever the paper has an influential finding, the researcher is research recognized.

Rule13: Either the paper is published in a predatory journal or, if the paper is peer reviewed, then under the condition that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized.
Rule14: If the paper is retracted, then it is not the case that the paper is corrected.
Rule15: Either the paper is retracted or the paper is submitted to a high impact journal.
Rule16: Whenever the allegation is investigated, then if the paper is retracted, the paper is corrected.
Rule17: Either the journal is published in predatory or the researcher meets the tenure track condition.
Rule18: If the paper is accepted in a reputable journal, then it is not the case that the journal is published in predatory.
Rule19: Provided that the author appealed the decision, the author withdrew the submission.
Rule20: If the researcher uses the open science platform, then whenever the author has access to the research platform, the project is research successful.
Rule21: Given that it is not true that, provided the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized, then the author appealed the decision.
Rule22: Under the condition that it is false that, if the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is not plagiarized, it is not the case that the author withdrew the submission.
Rule23: If it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher did not collaborate with a statistician.
Rule24: Provided that the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.
Rule25: Whenever the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, it is not the case that the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.
Rule26: If the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is plagiarized.
facts: Fact1: The paper is peer reviewed.
Fact3: The author has access to the research platform.
Fact4: It is not the case that the researcher has programming skill.
Fact5: The paper is not published in a predatory journal.
